证据片段: The oxidation kinetics of Zircaloy-4 in steam have been extended to 2400°C

证据片段: Growth of the ZrO₂ and α-Zr(O) layers display parabolic behavior over the entire temperature range studied

证据片段: a discontinuity in the oxidation kinetics above 1510°C causes rates to increase above those previously established by the Baker-Just relationship

证据片段: Experiments have been performed in steam-hydrogen mixtures at 1565 and 1815°C

证据片段: Concentrations of hydrogen up to 90 mol% have no effect on the oxidation kinetics

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk1
证据片段: Experiments were performed on disk specimens 3.8 mm diameter by 0.9 mm thick

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk1
证据片段: The nominal alloy composition in weight percent was 1.5 Sn, 0.20 Fe, 0.11 Cr, 0.125 O, 0.016 C, 0.004 N, and 0.001 H

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk1
证据片段: Isothermal oxidation experiments were conducted between 1300 and 2400°C

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk1
证据片段: Steam, preheated to 600°C, was then introduced through a fast-acting valve at a rate of 3 g/min

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk1
证据片段: Standard deviation for the isothermal temperature was 7°C at 1600°C

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk2
证据片段: selected experiments with thicker samples (1.4 and 1.9 mm thick) displayed the same oxide-growth kinetics as the standard 0.9 mm thick) samples

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk2
证据片段: each 100 μm of oxide thickness resulted in an additional temperature drop of about 50°C across the sample

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk2
证据片段: experiments were performed where the oxidation kinetics were compared among samples exposed to different steam-flow rates, varying from 3 to 18 g/min

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: The temperature dependence of the growth constants for the ZrO₂ and for the combined layer thickness are presented in Figs. 4a and 4b. The data measured on the heated and nonheated surfaces produced two distinct curves with approximately the same slope and activation energies.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: The temperature dependence of the growth constants for the ZrO₂ and for the combined layer thickness are presented in Figs. 4a and 4b. The data measured on the heated and nonheated surfaces produced two distinct curves with approximately the same slope and activation energies.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: A discontinuity in the growth rate is observed around 1510°C This is associated with the development of the cubic high-temperature oxide phase [4].

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: No other discontinuity in growth rate was observed, neither upon melting of the underlying metal at 1980°C nor upon transformation of the duplex (tetragonal and cubic) ZrO₂ layer to a single-phase cubic oxide at 2285°C.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: No other discontinuity in growth rate was observed, neither upon melting of the underlying metal at 1980°C nor upon transformation of the duplex (tetragonal and cubic) ZrO₂ layer to a single-phase cubic oxide at 2285°C.

证据片段: Below 1510°C the β-Zr reacts with oxygen to form a layer of tetragonal ZrO₂ and a layer of oxygen-stabilized α-Zr(O)

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: Below 1510°C the β-Zr reacts with oxygen to form a layer of tetragonal ZrO₂ and a layer of oxygen-stabilized α-Zr(O)

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: Depending on the oxygen content of the metal, β-Zircaloy melts at 1760 to 1940°C and α-Zr(O) at 1900 to 1975°C

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: Depending on the oxygen content of the metal, β-Zircaloy melts at 1760 to 1940°C and α-Zr(O) at 1900 to 1975°C

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: Thus above 1980°C the metal phase exists as a single molten phase and the only reaction product that forms is the duplex oxide

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: Thus above 1980°C the metal phase exists as a single molten phase and the only reaction product that forms is the duplex oxide

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk3
证据片段: The presence of the α-Zr(O) metal stringers in the oxide are a product of the eutectoid decomposition that the substoichiometric cubic oxide undergoes upon cooling through 1490°C to form α-Zr(O), about 10 vol%, and tetragonal ZrO₂

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk4
证据片段: A discontinuity in the growth-rate constants of the reaction layers at 1510°C occurs as a result of the change in oxide crystal structure from tetragonal to a duplex tetragonal and cubic layer

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk4
证据片段: No discontinuity in oxide-growth rate occurs upon melting of the metal phase (at least if it remains nonturbulent) or when the oxide becomes a single cubic phase at about 2285°C

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk4
证据片段: The presence of large amounts of hydrogen, up to at least 90 mol% hydrogen, mixed with the steam does not affect the oxidation rates so long as the steam supply to the sample surface is sufficient

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk5
证据片段: The majority of experiments were performed on disks $3 . 9 \ \mathrm { m m }$ in diameter and $0 . 9 \ \mathrm { m m }$ thick.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk5
证据片段: additional experiments were conducted on larger samples, 1.4 or $1 . 9 \ \mathrm { m m }$ thick and up to $5 \mathrm { \ m m }$ in diameter.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk5
证据片段: No difference in oxide growth rates was observed.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk5
证据片段: several specimens were reheated to $6 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ in a furnace and then slowly cooled to enhance hydride formation.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk5
证据片段: Hydrides were observed only in the sample exposed to the pure hydrogen environment.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk5
证据片段: The hydrogen dissolved in the oxide layers has not yet been determined.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_038_chunk5
证据片段: Measurements on the cold side of the sample were conducted only up to $1 8 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$

证据片段: Above $1 8 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ these times became excessively short, less than $2 0 \ \mathsf { s }$ .
